description: This is a short hike near Port Hawkesbury in a relatively flat area.   The surprise and turn around point of the hike is a nice and unexpected waterfall of about 12ft.The hike is a bushwack type.  The forest is not open but neither is is very hard to push through.  follow the stream upstream of the bridge for a few minutes to the waterfall.
directions: In Port Hawkesbury.  Take Port Malcolm Rd towards Bear Head.  Make the turn to continue on Port Malcolm Rd at N45° 34' 22.5" W61° 20' 13.4".  Park at; N45° 34' 45.1" W61° 17' 46.3".  Fall is at;  N45° 34' 46.4" W61° 17' 56.0"
title: Coal Brook Fall
